alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 3:44PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Morris, northeastern Hunterdon, southwestern Sussex, Warren, east central Monroe and northeastern Northampton Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 343 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms with a history of producing wind gusts from 35 to 45 mph along a line extending from near Echo Lake to near Belvidere to Alpha. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Easton, Newton, Hackettstown, Washington, Blairstown, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Alpha, Hope, Glen Gardner, Hampton, Califon, Branchville, Delaware Water Gap, Andover, Brass Castle, Werry Lake, Greendell and Millbrook. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 6. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
